title: Causes of Non-Cardiac Chest Pain
abstract: Non-cardiac chest pain can stem from gastroesophageal reflux disease, esophageal spasm, anxiety disorders, and musculoskeletal strain. Clinical evaluation should rule out acute coronary syndromes before considering benign etiologies.

title: Approach to Acute Coronary Syndrome
abstract: Acute coronary syndrome presents with chest tightness, diaphoresis, and shortness of breath. Red-flag symptoms warrant immediate emergency evaluation and troponin testing.

title: Functional Dyspepsia Overview
abstract: Functional dyspepsia is characterized by postprandial fullness, early satiety, and epigastric pain. Dietary triggers and stress modulation can mitigate symptoms; alarm features require endoscopic evaluation.
